ratings.comment: Prof Mcmahon means well but honestly I would avoid. She is incredibly disorganized, inapproachable, and has had a variety of situations that have left students (both undergraduate and graduate) feeling unheard and uncomfortable. Worksheets were posted late and incorrectly, and spent too long on personal tangents instead of teaching content.

The discussion activities were tangentially related to lecture content and the pre-class videos/assignments were not always posted at an appropriate time. She plays music at the start of each pre-class video that is related. Playlist is on Spotify as CEE 320 video songs

She cares about her students, but her class is terrible. The material is delivered in a "Hybrid" way with online and in person lectures. Neither of which relate to the homework and exams that are the entire grade in the class. When the class has a low exam average, she proceeds to tell everyone to "try harder" instead of evaluating her teaching.

She is unorganized in her teaching and then when students overall do "bad" on her exams she tells us she is disappointed and wants us to work harder. The overall processes we are supposed to be learning and the exams are graded really tough. The problem sets each week do not help you understand the material it is just frustrating and confusing.
Reacted to bad exam averages by telling students to try harder making class material more difficult.
The class average on the first exam was pretty low and she addressed it by saying everyone needs to try harder.

This class is a hybrid of in-person and online. Very unorganized. A lot of unnecessary homework. Problem sets are your best resource. Take home exams take 3+ hours each. Lectures are useful half the time. This class is a lot of busy work and is unorganized.

The most clear cut course you will find in Engineering. There is a lot of work but it is consistent and relating to all quizzes and exams you will take. If you need help ask, Trina and the TA are great about clarifying information. Also teaches hybrid course so expect online and in class lectures.
Great! Always enthusiastic and helpful- and a little sassy. Parts of exams fine, part expected too much chemistry knowledge

She has a round-a-bout way of teaching with videos and quizzes and lectures but half the time she puts the videos up sunday night or monday morning for a monday morning lecture (expects you to have watched them).  Plays acid rock at the beginning of all her lectures and jacks up the sound on her microphone.

She was a horrible professor for this course. It was her first time teaching and she had no idea what she was teaching. Basically, her teaching was all over the place. Her exam questions were very vague and you just don't know what she wants. Students make some arguments, and she lost her stands making everything confusing. Never seem prepared

Not a good teacher. Doesn't know the material, homework requires learning completely new material, proven wrong by students on a daily basis, and can't get through a lecture without spelling words wrong. Clearly not a microbiology professor, so I don't know what she's doing outside the engineering cave.

Very enthusiastic about the subject, which always makes for a better learning experience, The answers to all quizzes, hw, etc, are put online, so there's plenty to study from, and when students are struggling with something, she puts extra aids up online. Great class to take.

Trina is exciting, plays music before class, uses chalk boards extensively with lots of notes, creates exciting lectures and knows her materials. Readily answers questions, Knows how to teach. She handles the material very well. The book sucked.. but she made it work! Also uses I-clickers, Good homework, and medium quizzes. Study, practice and Ace!

It was just for WISE seminar--One credit class. She no longer does it, but she was great. Always very enthusiastic. Weekly guest speakers and she appeared more interested than any of her students. very approachable, and great personality.

Fantastic. Class is designed for you to learn the material. Weekly homework and quizzes are easy and require little time but help you learn the material. She puts solutions to all homework, quizzes, etc. on Learn@UW so its almost too easy to study for exams. Very enthusiastic, clear, personable, straight forward, and responds well to questions.
Her exams are a little tough. You get an 8 1/2 x 11 note card for each exam. HW is a little time consuming, but it makes you learn the material. Very Enthusiastic and helpful.

Very helpful, even when asked questions outside of office hours.  She never has a frown or gives snide remark to questions!  Exams are based on problem solving done in class.  Just attend lecture and you will be fine.
No Comments
A high-spirited prof who highly encourages student interaction during discussions.  Very personable and seems to enjoy her profession very much.  A+ professor.
Interesting class, and a pretty good professor. She's VERY enthusiastic.
